RH Burger - Sharp American, Pickle, Onion, Dijonnaise, Lettuce and Pickle.
RH Burger - Sharp American, Pickle, Onion, Dijonnaise, Lettuce and Pickle. Fries served with roasted garlic aioli.

review.des:
Looks like I have a new favorite place in Chicago, I been here two times and I can't wait to go back. This place is BEAUTIFUL, decoration is classy and relaxing. One of a kind.

**FOOD: I highly recommend the RH Scramble with soft eggs, it was the best scrambles I have ever had. So rich in flavors and the Texas toast was to die for. My friend had the Shaved Prime Rib French Dip and she loved it. Even the French fries are amazing. The chocolate chip cookies are good if you have a sweet tooth (not my favorite). The sorbet is a must.
**DRINK: I highly recommend the mimosas (strong but very good), the Bellini is very good too. We also had; chai latte and a cappuccino.

Pros: big portions, amazing service, and unforgettable food.
Cons: I wish they were open early.

I HIGHLY recommend this place. You won't regret it. Perfect for a date or even brunch with friends.

pics.caption: Chocolate chip cookie, vanilla ice cream, and chai latte

review.des:
3ACC has just become one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. Food was excellent but what pushes this place over the top is the atmosphere. Sunlight penetrates the glass ceiling to fill the room. The European stone fountain glistens in the heart of the atrium as you hear trickling water complementing the chatter amongst good friends. Large trees add a splash of natural green to the surrounding brick walls. Crystal chandeliers adorned with hundreds of lights make you wonder whether this is all a dream... That's certainly what I thought when I first saw photos on Yelp, but I can tell you that it's all very real.

We ordered the Artisanal Prosciutto to start, complete with parmesan cheese, grapes, and a small, warm baguette - a perfect combination. My main dish was the Truffled Grilled Cheese, also delicious despite some areas being a little more burnt than I personally prefer. The fries and garlic aioli couldn't be better though.

As for the wait, it's a popular spot so expect a long one. We came at 12:30ish on a Sunday (prime brunch/lunch hours) and waited about an hour and a half. It was significantly emptier when we were done at 3 if you're willing to come at off hours. While we waited, we wandered around all the beautiful rooms of Restoration Hardware. Make sure to get a view of the cafe from the second floor and check out the chill seating area and garden on the top floor. A lot of people also grab drinks from the bar and lounge around on one of the many chairs/couches throughout the building.

Protip: arrive about half an hour before they open to guarantee a shorter wait!

If you're visiting downtown and looking for a picturesque urban escape, make a visit to 3 Arts Club. It's a restaurant that also serves as an urban oasis; blending nature with modern elegance. Make sure to bring a camera because the interior is gorgeous. 3 Arts club is nestled within Restoration Hardware (RH). Enter from the RH entrance then make a left to the hostess table for seating. Â 

I was accompanied by a friend for a weekend lunch around 3pm and we placed ourselves in queue for a table. Our hostess then gave us a buzzer and told us our wait time would be approximately 50 minutes. It would've been convenient to make a reservation prior to our visit but I was told they only accept walk-ins.

Despite the lengthy wait, we decided to stay. We had traveled a ways to get here and canceling plans would be a fruitless disappointment. Plus, I had my heart set on visiting this place, so we were going to wait. During our wait, we wandered around the cavernous 4 story confines of Restoration Hardware. Â I will post a separate review for the store at a later date as this review solely focuses on the 3 Arts Club experience.

Once our table opened up, the hostess led us into the restaurant. As I stepped foot into the restaurant, two words came to mind, exquisite and stunning.

The first thing you'll notice from above is the chandelier. The brilliant crystal tiers hung from the glass ceiling supported by steel beams. The natural light shining through the ceiling illuminated the space; contrasting the dark and dreary afternoon we experienced outdoors. Massive planters with live trees towering upwards toward the ceiling lined all 4 corners of the space giving it an earthy feel. Plush contemporary dining furniture complemented the look giving it a cozy vibe. Top it all with a patina fountain in the center and you've got the components for a beautiful event space.

This restaurant makes for a great meet-up spot and the ambiance is amazing; however the food leaves much to be desired. A burger and fries cost nearly $20 (which doesn't include your drink and tip.) Reflecting back on my meal, I wasn't over the moon with it. My burger patty was thick, bland, and dry. It was a far cry from burgers I've had elsewhere and I'll never order this again. In fact, I've had better hot dogs (and didn't have to wait an hour) coming out of a Home Depot compared to the standard casual fare offered here.

In addition to my subpar lunch, I can't say much for our server either. I could see she was obviously overwhelmed by the tables she had. At the end of our meal, when I wanted to split our check, she didn't like the idea and her displeasure showed in her body language. The minute I requested a split check, I was met with an eye roll and a no. That didn't sit right with me at all. A split check is a common ask and at a place where a subpar burger and fries cost over $20, such a simple thing should be automatic. It's bad enough the burger was a disappointment but I didn't need it served with a side of attitude.

It's pretty obvious by the clientele that the dress code commands a step above casual. It isn't necessary to be dressed in cocktail attire but I did see a couple or two dressed like that here. I had to chuckle a bit for their pretentiousness but when in Rome...

Overall, I thought it was a beautiful space but it was nothing more than that. Unless you live near the area or are staying in a nearby hotel, expect your commute to be terrible. Â It will cost an extra $15ish for valet if you drive in. The Gold Coast area is prime real estate and because of it, parking is a nightmare. For the budget conscious, your best bet is to take public transport. Go for the ambiance but other than that, this visit is a one and done.

pics.caption: View of 3 Arts Club from the 2nd floor window of Restoration Hardware (RH).

review.des: 3 Arts Club Cafe is located inside Restoration Home, which is a great excuse to eat and look at nice furniture after! The atmosphere is an A+, it's quiet, beautiful, but I did not like that I was very far away from the people on the opposite side because the table was that wide. They don't get a full 5 stars because the food was very expensive for things I can get elsewhere, i.e. salad, burger, grilled cheese (which doesn't come with tomato soup, nor do they make tomato soup...how do you eat there grilled cheese then?? Plain! How disappointing!) My prime rib sandwich was delicious nonetheless and their juices were amazing. I would have to be in the mood to come to this place again. Only a very once in a while place to go.

Although very pretty, it was slightly overrated.

The ambiance and service was great. There's a very simplistic yet elegant style to the cafe. Glass chandeliers and plants all around. The service was also great. The waitstaff was always attentive and filling water on time.

What I wasn't a fan of was the food. There weren't that many menu options. The food wasn't bad but wasn't out of the world. I got the scramble, which was literally the best option for breakfast unless I wanted just jam and toast. I loved their iced coffee though.

Overall, I would come here to do it one time and get a feel of the cool vibes, but don't except to be wowed by the food.

Tip: If you don't want to wait in a crazy line, come at 9:30am to start lining up. It opens at 10 but the line starts growing at 9:45. I was able to be seated first since I was first in line.

UPDATE:

Came back for dinner on a Friday night with a friend and had a MUCH better experience. There was much less of a wait and the atmosphere seemed very relaxed, rather than frantic. Our server, Anthony, was incredible! He was perfect- funny, attentive, and just overall wonderful. The food for dinner was better than brunch. I got the French dip and my friend got the garlic roasted chicken. While both were very tasty, I still think it was a bit overpriced. However, when you factor in the atmosphere, the price makes sense.

Overall, this is a fantastic place for a special occasion. Take my word for it and go for lunch/dinner instead of weekend brunch. You'll get a much better experience!

No thanks. This is clearly a gimmick restaurant that relies on the fact that people wait in line so long to get in to continue to get people in.

This is a GORGEOUS restaurant. Absolutely beautiful atmosphere, both in the atrium and adjoining "wine bar". I can see why this was on my friend's list of "must go" atmosphere restaurants in Chicago. However, this is a rip-off tourist/gimmick trap that is a nightmare on all counts that don't involve the beautiful atrium.

They do not take reservations. So my friend and I got in line at 10:45 in the massive line for opening at 11. We got to the host stand at 11:15 and we're sat at 11:45. The seating is comfy. The service is sub-standard for the prices they are charging. Everyone who came to our table was CLEARLY inexperienced in the service industry and I am shocked that a high end restaurant had service like this. We barely saw our server and she was awkward at best.

Now let's talk about how these people want to charge completely ridiculous prices for mediocre at best food. My friend ordered a side of fruit- which had halved grapes, bananas, and a couple pieces of cantaloupe for $6. I ordered a "ham and cheese" croissant which had about one ounce of ham and if it had cheese I couldn't taste it for another $6. I did not like it. We split a side of bacon- $10, and this one was good. 4 thick slices of well seasoned bacon.

The people around us ordered more robust meals, and it was clear that their French fries ($8 for a side) are nothing special.

So maybe come and visit the pretty interior and then walk out. The service was mediocre at best, the food was not at all worth the price. This is clearly a gimmick and there are a billion great brunch places nearby that won't cost you a months worth of rent to eat at, and will taste way better

I had brunch here with my girlfriends. The space is amazing. Â As we waited for our table (60 min they don't take Â reservations) we were able to check out the restoration hardware furniture which the restaurant is conveniently located in the same space. The pieces were so beautiful. Made the wait worth it. We had the scrambled eggs and green salad. The Bacon was my favorite. Service was great. I would definitely go back for the ambiance & to check out the furniture.

pics.caption: I fell in love with these stones.

review.des:
5 stars for the ambiance, 3 stars for the price point and food. Evens out to a solid 4. Such an incredibly beautiful space to meet friends for a bite to eat or grab drinks! Located within Restoration Hardware, 3 Arts Cafe is a dreamy escape from chilly Chicago weather. The glass roof makes for great lighting even on gloomy days, like the day I came by!

I had the arugula salad and shared fries with my friend. Both were yummy, but honestly most of the things on the menu are probably too pricey for what the are and not worth the cost. Wish I'd had more time to come by to try brunch! If I'm ever in Chicago again, I'll definitely come again just because it's so damn pretty here!

The ambiance is "sit in a furniture store and chill" with lots of people around. Â I was pretty shocked at the prices ($18 for 4, yes FOUR slices of prosciutto) and expensive glasses of wine to accompany them. Â I will say, however, that the snacks were tasty with crusty, tasty bread and fresh burrata and delicious soft cheese. Â I'd go back just for the overpriced meat and cheese plates!

Gorgeous place with great food! There is always a long wait to get a table but its totally worth the wait. This is a perfect place for first dates or catching up with a group of friends or for long conversations with someone etc... when you're done eating, be sure to go upstairs and check out the restoration hardware store! You'll love it!!

The most glam lunch experience I've ever had.

I saw a picture of this gorgeous place on Instagram and have been drooling over it ever since. The building is located in the fancy Gold Coast neighborhood of Chicago. The building itself used to be a women's arts club that was built in the early 1900's. When you walk into the architecture of the building feels so timeless and elegant, from the chandeliers, to the marble tables, and fountains, everything is so 'IG worthy'. I arrived right when they opened and was seated right away. I ordered the lobster roll (delicious) and enjoyed taking in the ambiance of such a beautiful space. After lunch I walked around to the different showrooms and daydreamed on all that is Restoration Hardware #HouseGoals then proceeded up to their rooftop garden. Such a memorable place and I can't wait to visit again when I'm back in Chicago!

The best time to come here is on a weekday morning. My friends and I came here on a Thursday and had a lovely brunch. Well actually we all ended up ordering the burger because it sounded so good...and it was! Definitely can give Au Chevalier a run for its money.

The ambience is what makes this place. You feel like you're eating outdoors or that you're in a greenhouse. It is very beautifully decorated. Service is pretty good too.

Overall a very scenic place to eat and you must get the burger!

Wow- this lunch was the highlight of my trip to Chicago. I am currently eating a ketogenic Diet, and they were VERY accommodating. I had a bun less burger with a side of garlic aioli and kale Caesar salad. We sat in the middle of the atrium, the ambiance is AMAZING. While we waited for our table, we explored the building.

Seriously what is there not to like.

Awesome atmosphere

Simple menu

Amazing decor

Food is delicious and very well executed.

It would have been 5 stars but the sever was a bit slow and overwhelmed.

You have to visit

I have wanted to go to 3 Arts Club Cafe located inside of Restoration Hardware for a while now. The few times I have tried, the wait time was over a two hours. Finally, my boyfriend suggested that we go on a weekday around lunch. Fortunately, NO WAIT TIME!

The food is inspired by Northern California and Mediterranean cuisine and the courtyard seating is beautifully filled with natural sunlight and olive trees. We started the morning off with some flavored ice coffee on draft along with a late brunch. There were so many amazing options on the menu but of course I picked the one that had truffle and cheese: truffle grilled cheese sandwich on sourdough bread served with fries and garlic aÃ¯oli. My boyfriend, on the other hand, chose the breakfast route and ordered the RH scramble: farm eggs, crÃ¨me frÃ¢iche, avocado, chives, Texas toast.

After our wonderful brunch we decided to continue enjoying our day and ordered a bottle of wine. We got a bottle of Riesling: Leitz, Rheingau, Germany, 2016. 3 Arts Club Cafe isn't only a wonderful brunch spot, but it is also a great spot for drinks.

We had already been at 3 Arts Club Cafe for a few hours are this point, and decided to spend the rest of the afternoon on the rooftop since the weather was beautiful. On our way to the rooftop we stopped and got another draft iced coffee and doughnut. They have doughnuts from Doughnut Vault, which were DELICIOUS! Definitely have to go and try all their flavors soon!

pics.caption: Nothing like a coconut donut and iced coffee on a warm spring day

review.des:
Extremely beautiful cafe with tasty brunch!

The cafe sits inside of restoration hardware furniture store. There is no doubt that the decor is one of the best I have ever seen! Comfortable couch, beautiful chandelier and greens.

We ordered smoked salmon and artisanal prosciutto to start with. The smoked salmon came with warm toast and it was great! Among the main dishes we got, the lobster roll was the best. Fresh and creamy.

The highlight of the meal was the RH Banana split. It came with different sprinkles!

The waiting was extremely painful. They opened at 11:00 AM on Sunday and we arrived at 10:50 AM. It took us 1.5 hours to get a table (they do not take reservations).

Went with a friend mostly to explore the atmosphere. We planned on dining however there was an hour wait for parties of two by the time we arrived at 2pm.

We grabbed two caramel lattes, one with skim the other with soy. We also bought one chocolate chip cookie. Our total was $16. Pricey but both of us agreed that they were the best lattes we'd ever had. We traveled around the floors, the staff was kind somewhat. One of the older men kept following us around as if we were up to something. He was a little agest but thats fine.

First floor was super crowded, I recommend checking out the rooftop garden instead. Nice place, but slightly overpriced. This place is more about the look and culture than the food.

This place is a true beauty. Unfortunately, we didn't get to try their food. We did, however, ordered a bottle of wine. With our glasses of wine, we explored the place and the furniture and art stores upstairs. We also got to sit wherever we wanted. There were comfy couches everywhere. It was a fun experience. I cannot wait to come back and try their food!

I had such a hard time figuring out where the cafe was located just to find out it was located inside Restoration Hardware! The moment I stepped in I was immediately in awe; it was interior design heaven; a glorified IKEA! The wait to eat inside was roughly at least 30 minutes but it makes you wish the wait was longer as you venture off to the beautiful room displays on each floor. The food itself was top notch with the environment of the cafe making it so elegant.

pics.caption: This could've easily been a ballroom
Had grilled cheese and lobster roll

review.des: Built in 1914, the Three Arts Club of Chicago was a Chicago home and club for women in the "three arts" of music, painting and drama. (Thanks Wikipedia!) The building is a landmark and a flagship showcase for Restoration Hardware, the inside is incredibly well-appointed and I believe RH uses the venue to build brand affinity rather than actually sell any true volume of products. The Atrium and and the Rooftop (on a sunny) day are fantastic. There's a cafe where you can order wine to take up to the Rooftop while you wait for your table in the Atrium. (that's a serving suggestion...) The food was extremely good and worth the wait. I have to say I would not have gone here were it not so strongly recommended and I agree. If you have the time, it is well worth it.

pics.caption: One of the showrooms (on Floors 2 - 4) the rooftop garden is on the 5th Floor

review.des:
What a unique concept to have a restaurant inside a furniture store. But hey...it works and it works really well! This restaurant is situated inside the restoration hardware furniture store. It's beautiful inside the restaurant. There is natural light that comes in - the ceiling is all glass. Â There are a mix of sofas and chairs inside which make the ambiance more inviting.
Be ready for a wait. We heard on the weekends the line goes outside the building. We went on a Monday and there was still about a 45 minute wait.
The grilled cheese is excellent but it is a bit heavy. It was all I had all day except for a light late dinner.
The burrata and tomatoes were also excellent. The tomatoes were roasted and so so sweet. Â The burrata was imported from Europe. Â The bread was excellent as well. Â It was perfectly toasted and substantial.

pics.caption: Burrata with amazing olive oil and roasted tomatoes

review.des:
I'm a big fan of 3 Arts Club Cafe. The service, food and atmosphere are all excellent reasons for making this Golf Coast neighborhood gem a destination everyone must experience. When you are done with you dining experience...be sure to explore the multiple floors of Restoration Hardware home interiors and furnishings showcased through this refurbished historical building. That's right...there a wonderful history to this remarkable space....not that you needed another reason to drop in to the 3 Arts Club.

Go on...go explore. Enjoy!

Unique restaurant spot that is nestled within a furniture store. Â The waits are long but it is not too bad when you have some time, and walk around to shop or get decor ideas. Â We came here on a Saturday and the place was packed. Â We grabbed a few drinks at the bar and walked around the store for a few hours before our table was ready.

The service was good and friendly. Â We ordered a few items to share and had cocktails. Â The grilled cheese was surprisingly good, and was well complimented with the garlic aioli fries. Â If you don't have time or patience, this is not the place for you. Â The decor of the restaurant is beautiful!

I wish I could give more stars but alas, I am stuck at 5. This restaurant serves the best at an affordable price.

The decor is beautiful and makes one feel as if one is dining in a posh country club outside with lots of natural light coming in from the skylight.

The food is superb with each dish a culinary delight. I highly, highly recommend the burrata and the lobster roll.

The only down for this place is that the wait can be long unless you are one the first people in line as soon as it opens. Any other time, it could be an hour plus wait which you could spend looking at all the amazing furniture of the place.

My group consisted of 6 people and we waited in line 1 1/2 hours before it opened on a Sunday. We were second in line and it was well worth the wait. When it started getting close to 11am, the line was wrapped around the corner of the building.

There's street parking around the area and they've valet service which was $12. Â 

The place is very beautiful! It was very clean and the staff were very welcoming when they opened.

I ordered the truffled grilled cheese with fries. The grilled cheese was amazing and had great flavors. The fries were great as well. My cousins ordered lobster rolls and it looked amazing! We all enjoyed our food had no problems.

I would def come back here and i suggest everyone to try this place out.

This place is one of the prettiest restaurants in Chicago. The interior is beautiful, it's definitely a great fancy brunch place. Also a great place to take pictures, do photo shoots and just enjoy Chicago in the summer.

The food is good but I've only tried a couple of things on the menu. I've had their parfait which was good and eggs with avocado and toast. Which was all really good! Loved the atmosphere and the service. Hands down one of my fave summer places in Chicago. Would definitely go back!

The only thing I thought was weird was that when my friend who had a film camera was taking a picture of me, one of the hosts told her we can't take pictures in the indoor area which I thought I was weird and a little annoying.

This is an absolutely charming hidden gem in Lincoln Park. It's definitely got an LP vibe, but it also feels like being transported to a chic Instagram lifestyle post. It's hidden inside the 'RH' which is code name for Restoration Hardware! Enjoy a beverage--adult and/or caffeinated--while shopping on the 5 floors of showrooms or while waiting 30 minutes for a table in the 3 Arts Club Cafe atrium. On nice days, the 5th floor is the patio furniture store and you can sit and sip outside. How neat!

On the menu try the DÃ©lice de Bourgogne triple creme cheese plate with delightfully roasted pecans and the Greek assyritiko white wine. Be transported out of Chicago!

Beautiful atmosphere Â especially if you like posting pictures on Instagram this is the right place for it. The waiting time to be seated is long, but you can exploer the other floors :) make sure you check the roof top It's very nice. We had to wait about 40-45 minutes for party of 2 and honestly it wasn't that bad because we were checking the other floors.
The food here is overpriced for what they serve you. Also doesn't have that many options for food! you should check the menu before you go because as I have said the place it's beautiful for pictures, but if you are not a fan of taking pictures and don't care about the atmosphere don't go there and waste your money.
I think it would be better to go there for a drink or for cappuccinos and cookies.

I absolutely love the 3 Arts Club Cafe. I have never been to any place like this before. They have a restaurant that is in a courtyard of the building. It is an enclosed courtyard with a water fountain, trees, ivy climbing on the brick walls, Â and marble tables. It is basically like being outdoors.

The restaurant was beautiful and a perfect place to take someone for a date or a small get together. They don't take reservations in advance so you have to wait to put your name on a list when you get there. They have a coffee shop in the building with plush white couches and large chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.

They don't have many food options, Â it's mostly a place to get a glass of wine, Â cookies or a cheese platter. We ordered some wine and had cookies. It was a great place, a bit pricey but I will definitely be coming back for the beautiful indoor experience.

pics.caption: Iced coffee from their coffee shop while we waited

review.des:
Gorgeous space, great food and fantastic service!

I've been yearning to give this place a try for so long and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

I went here on a Sunday with a group of 6. We got there really early to get a spot in line and I'm so glad we did! By the time it opened, the line was so long that they had to cut it off- forcing those at the end of the line to wait an extra hour or two.

The menu pretty simple and everything (food and drink) we tried was delicious! My favorites were the truffles grilled cheese and the smoked salmon board. Our server was great- he provided some recommendations, was attentive and very patient as well.

After brunch, we spent a good amount of time just wandering around restoration hardware, admiring the beautiful furniture and room designs on each floor.

5 stars, easily!

We stumbled upon this place while exploring the Gold Coast. Immediately upon walking in we were taken aback by the ambiance of this place. The food / service was also really good.

Would give it 5 out of 5 if they offered some type of soup (maybe a tomato bisque to go with the grilled cheese ).

pics.caption: Don't think that Chicago dining only offers Deep dish pizza. This spot is a hidden gem. The service, ambiance, food, etc was spot on.

review.des:
INTERIOR DESIGN GOALS!! Absolutely gorgeous space with wonderful decor and ambiance. So much natural lighting and greenery mixed in with the architectural furniture - everything was on point - an Instagrammers dream.

The restaurant opened at 11am, but my friend got a place in line at 10:40am. There was already a huge line wrapping inside and outside the building, and we still ended up having to wait 15 minutes before being seated. Perhaps the weekdays aren't as busy.

Service was decent. Prices aren't super expensive either, for the bougieness level. I ordered the RH Scramble which comes with scrambled eggs (perfectly cooked), half an avocado (which you can use to make your own avo toast), and Texas toast (delicious but quite buttery and heavy after a while).

I would definitely come back if I'm in the area! Highly recommend - if not for the food, then at least come to feast your eyes on the building!

This place is absolutely stunning. I'll be honest and tell you that I came for the sole purpose of pictures. I did not have high expectations in regards to the food because pretty places tend not to have amazing food.

I ordered the RH Scramble with a side of bacon for a grand total of $22 pretax. I was pleasantly surprised to have nothing bad to say about the food itself! The flavors were all very good. The avocado was fresh, bread was good, eggs were cooked to my liking. The bacon was also the boujeeist bacon I have ever had! A very thick cut with amazing maple flavor. Was it worth $25+? Probably not but I felt like I was paying for the entire experience as a whole as opposed to just the food.

Things to note: this place does not take reservations so if you come on a busier day (i.e. the weekends), be prepared to wait at least an hour before being seated. This is normally not a problem because it gives you ample time to explore the rest of the building (which is a must!). So many great Insta opportunities! Definitely a Chicago gem!

By far one of my favorite cafes. Whilst waiting for our table, we sipped on wine and ventured throughout the magnificently designed rooms. I smell a large furniture purchase in my future.

We were notified via text when our table was ready. To our luck, we sat at a table next to two famous athletes, of whom I will not name... the husband plays futbol and wife plays tennis.

The staff is attentive and friendly! A plus for any dining experience.

We ordered tea service, earl grey and English breakfast and it was impeccable. I love me a good cup of tea.

For starters, we shared the smoked salmon platter. Divine. A MUST-GET ITEM. We had the lobster roll, which came with chips. It was average to my liking. The filling to bread ratio was 1:4. We ordered an arugula salad which was good, but felt it lacking something. I will be returning to try the other items on the menu!

pics.caption: Tea service & the smoked salmon board

review.des: Awesome pastry and coffee. Â  It's also a showroom for RH. Â Was very nice sauntering around with a drink while waiting for a table in the beautiful courtyard.

Made a point to come here on a random Monday in the middle of day so we were seated immediately. Already I felt pretty smug having read the reviews of the looooong waits. You know what the cure for that smugness is? Looking at the price points of anything in the store. ouch.

But I digress. Service was lovely and attentive and they didn't seem to mind how many almost perfect instagram shots I tried to take of the gorgeous setting. We started off with some complimentary fries. Don't know what we did to deserve that but I don't even like fries and I ate more than my fair share! I was fighting a cold so I loved that I could get a fresh juice while the husband opted for wine.

We then moved on to the Burrata which was one of the most amazing treats we had in Chicago. Fresh tomatoes, delicious olive oil. So amazing. We then split the lobster roll which was killer. I normally find those super mayo-heavy and blah but this was by far the best I've had. Thick and juicy chunks of lobster, light on the mayo, and with perfectly buttered and crisped bread. So glad our server convinced us to go that way, it was a perfect recommendation.

We had a romantic brunch at this place. They have the Best "Burrata" in town!
We loved it! Artistic, romantic, cozy place. Good service too!
If you wish to dine and seat near the fountain, you better come 2hours before your set brunch as there are a lot of people willing to wait and be seated in that romantic area. However, there are a lot of seats, couches, available for everyone if your the type of person that wants to sit indoor and more private.

pics.caption: Trying the mirror on another floor of this building.
We've had a Romantic dining experience here.

review.des:
I went here for my birthday. I took the day off from work, dropped off the kids at school and went with the wifey. This place is AMAZING.

First, the building where this place is located is fantastic. This is a historic building that is exquisitely decorated through and through --and no surprises since this restaurant sits inside Restoration Hardware's flagship store in Chicago.

There are 4 floors here, and this Cafe sits on the first floor in a gorgeous domed patio with a fountain in the middle. Look at the pictures, but they do no justice until you're there. Amazing natural light everywhere.

There are sitting areas that are meticulously decorated, like living rooms, with couches and chairs, center tables. There are bistro-like tables and chairs which are quite comfy. Nice ambient music as well.

We ordered the RH Scramble + Bacon. I asked for my eggs a little firmer since we were told the way they prepare them are a little runny --related note: the other day I saw Chef Ramsey saying that runny was the way scrambled eggs should be... No thanks, Chef.

Eggs were really good! Very savory and with half an avocado sitting on the side, salt and cracked pepper on top. Their toast with strawberry marmalade was absolutely fantastic. Bread was super fluffy and the homemade marmalade amazing. The bacon was this thick-cut side order of amazing bacon cooked to perfection --about 5 slices. Coffee was good, too.

Service was very attentive and prompt, from the hostess to the server (shout out to Erin!). Presentation was great and overall a fantastic experience from start to finish!

Would I go back? ABSOLUTELY! Was it worth $70 with tips? Indeed.

Go here. NOW!

I have been to Chicago several times and have tried to get into this place so many times and FINALLY on this recent trip we were able to get in. The wait time was about 1.5 hours but we were totally okay with it because there is a side bar where you can ordered drinks and walk around the store.

While we were waiting for our table we visited the beautiful floors, my favorite was the rooftop.

Lunch was on another level of AMAZING. We got the kale Caesar salad, truffle grilled cheese and fries. Everything tasted excellent and fresh.

We were already extremely pleased with the place but what put the cherry on top is the manager came by and starting chatting with us after our meal. We told him we were from Michigan and were pleased with our visit to the 3 Arts Club Cafe.

He then came back with some cookies and milk for us to try... and they were delicious!

This place is absolutely worth the wait!!! A Chicago Must!

For this cafe housed in the restoration hardware which - yes - you can shop at (or pretend to) but go with hungry eyes, not a hungry stomach. The cafe is beautiful, like the restoration hardware house of your preteen dreams before you discovered what Whole Foods costs and brought those dreams down a bit. Housed all within a stunning courtyard, with flowing fountains, quaint trees, crystal chandeliers and some A++ people watching.

There is generally a wait for brunch or happy hour, but worth it to sit and bask in its gloriousness (or just for the instagram). A great place to take parents or grandparents or a date or girlfriends but not good for large groups.
